intro: Gilia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It produces clusters of small, showy flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its structure includes hairy stems and leaves, and it is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
